messages.message: Hey, I’m sorry I had to leave so suddenly. Are you still with Jack?
No, I’m home now. That was really confusing, Jack was worried that he gave you a bad impression.
Well, that’s what I wanted to talk about. I found his ID, his REAL ID, it says he’s 28 years old and his real name is Vincent.
What… Does he know you did that? Why were you snooping, you’re going to get us all in trouble.
That’s not the point, he’s lying about everything.
I know, I was just curious and I saw it peeking out. But, he’s not Jack, you’re not safe with him.
I’ll be fine it’s alright.
I just want to be there for you. Please talk to me Olivia, did you suspect that he was lying?
He lies about a lot of things, but I don't really want to talk about it right now.
No, he wouldn't do that to me.
How well do you really know him?
I'm sorry Olivia, but I saw it, he's not really Jack and he's a grown man.
I don't know... but I guess it makes some sense.
What do you mean? What else do I not know about?
What do you mean? You can tell me anything, I promise I won't judge.
I don't know if I should say. He just wasn't what I expected. Maybe it is normal though, maybe this is how relationships are.
MANY VICTIMS ARE TRAFFICKED BY ROMANTIC PARTNERS
Why would you think that?
It's what he and his friends say.
Well, if it's a normal relationship thing, then why can't you talk to me or others about it?
I can't tell you. If I tell you, everyone will know. My whole life will be over.
I won't tell anyone and I promise I won't judge.
I just can't tell you. I'm too ashamed and if I did, I'd get in trouble.
Did he threaten you or something?
PHYSICAL, PSYCHOLOGICAL, AND SEXUAL THREATS ARE USED TO COERCE AND CONTROL VICTIMS
I guess, it's embarrassing to say. You wouldn't really understand.
No, it's not, help me to understand then. I'll never judge you.
He has... private photos and videos of me. It's my fault, I should've never sent them to him.
It's not your fault, you're a teenager he's an adult, he should know better. Is he threatening to leak them if you tell someone?
TRAFFICKERS OFTEN FAKE THEIR IDENTITIES ONLINE TO RECRUIT VICTIMS
Yes, please don't tell anyone. I can't let him find out.
I won't say anything if you don't want that. If you're comfortable talking about it
what else did you mean when you said that he and his friends called the stuff you did "normal relationship things"?
It's a lot. I don't know, what will you think of me?
I'm not going to judge you, you don't have to be embarrassed or ashamed.
Sometimes he makes me go to these hotels and meet up with his "friends".
What do you mean by "friends" and what do you guys do there?
Well, he sometimes calls them that, to make me more comfortable with doing stuff for them, but they're really just clients.
What kind of stuff?
Is he making you do things you don't want to do? Are you really comfortable with it?
He makes me do... sexual things for his clients. I never wanted to do it. But he makes me feel important. Even if I wanted to stop and leave him, I can't.
You can always stop. It's dangerous and scary, but you can do it. I'm here for you. We can figure something out.
I'm scared, what if he hurts you or someone else I care about? I don't know what he's capable of.
No one has to get hurt. What he's doing is illegal. There are people you can talk to, only if you want to.
We can talk to them together and they can stop him from making you do things you don't want to be doing and leaking your photos.
I don't know who I can tell, what if they don't understand?
They will understand, there are police who are specialized in trafficking cases. I'll be right there with you too.
Alright, I'll call them.
HOTELS AND MOTELS ARE A COMMON VENUE FOR TRAFFICKING.
